Gossip Message format:
 <self.timestamp>:<self.IP>:<self.Msg#>

Gossip protocol:
 After a node (peer) generates a message M, it transmits M to all its adjacent nodes.
 On receipt of a message for the first time, a node records it in its Message List (ML),
 and forwards it to all peers except the sender.
 On receiving the same message subsequently, the node ignores it.

Reporting the node as ‘Dead’:
 When 3 consecutive ping messages do not receive a reply, the peer sends a message of the format:
 Dead Node:<DeadNode.IP>:<DeadNode.Port>:<self.timestamp>:<self.IP>

Program Output:
 Each seed logs connection requests and dead-node notifications.
 Each peer logs the list of neighbors obtained and each gossip message (with its timestamp and sender info).


Seed 192.168.1.11:6001 - Peer registered: 192.168.1.101:5000
Seed 192.168.1.10:6000 - Peer registered: 192.168.1.101:5000
Peer 192.168.1.101:5000 - Connected peers: 
Seed 192.168.1.11:6001 - Peer registered: 192.168.1.102:5001
